action.action-desc: Mr. Rodney Davis of Illinois (for himself, Mr. Carter of Texas, Mr. Harris, and Mr. O'Rourke) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Defense to provide travel to Dover Air Force Base for family members of members of the Armed Forces who die outside of the United States but not in a theater of combat operations so the family may receive the remains of the deceased.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Fallen Heroes Family Travel Act of 2018.

section.header: Transportation of remains of casualties; travel expenses for next of kin

subsection.header: Transportation for remains of a member who dies not in a theater of combat operations
subsection.text: Section 562 of the John Warner National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2007 (Public Law 109–364; 10 U.S.C. 1482 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: in the heading, by striking dying in a theater of combat operations; and
in subsection (a), by striking in a combat theater of operations and inserting outside of the United States.

subsection.text: The Secretary of Defense shall revise Department of Defense Instruction 1300.18 to extend travel privileges via Invitational Travel Authorization to family members of members of the Armed Forces who die outside of the United States and whose remains are returned to the United States through the mortuary facility at Dover Air Force Base, Delaware.
